intro: Celosia cymosa, commonly known as firecracker grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its vibrant, plume-like inflorescences that resemble fireworks, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its foliage is narrow and grass-like, with leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Celosia cymosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display and drought tolerance.
